thread.title: Romeo romps in MAC Red girls cross country jamboree
thread.title_full: Romeo romps in MAC Red girls cross country jamboree

author: George Pohly
title: Romeo romps in MAC Red girls cross country jamboree
text:
The champs are off and running.
Lillian Deskins finished first to help Romeo sweep the first five places as the Bulldogs rolled in the Macomb Area Conference Red Division cross country jamboree Wednesday.
Deskins, a senior, finished in 19:00.3 and Violet Hrabovsky, Annie Hrabovsky, Natalia Guaresimo and Olivia Purdy followed her to the finish line as the defending state Division 1 champions scored the minimum of 15 points at Stony Creek Eastwood Beach.
Related Articles High School Sports | William Puzinsky’s pair of penalty saves preserves Lutheran North’s win over Cranbrook High School Sports | Photo gallery from Bloomfield Hills Cranbrook-Kingswood vs. Lutheran North boys soccer High School Sports | WISE GUY: MAC Red vs. White superiority up for grabs in Week 2 High School Sports | Romeo’s ‘variety’ instrumental in MAC Red win over Anchor Bay High School Sports | LaMilza leads Dakota to first place at MAC Red cross country jamboree “The goal was to work together and help each other through it,” senior Violet Hrabovsky said.
All five Romeo scorers were in the lineup when the Bulldogs won the state meet last November.
“We had a couple people racing for the first time this season,” Guaresimo said, “so we were trying to help them, pick them up as we went along.”
It was the second meet of the season for Romeo. Coach Mike Buslepp’s team won the Early Bird Open at Huron Meadows Metropark on Aug. 29.
“It’s good to know that you feel good and confident at this part of the season so you can finish strong,” Purdy said.
Grace Grupido of Fraser finishes sixth at the MAC Red jamboree at Stony Creek on Wednesday, Sept. 4, 2024. Fraser joined the division this year, moving up from the White. (GEORGE POHLY for MediaNews Group) Romeo’s 2-5 runners bunched together at the finish, crossing the line in a range of 19:19.8 to 19:20.6.
Utica finished second with 67 points. Dakota was third with 82 on a warm and sunny afternoon.
Utica was led by Sophia Aquino and Brooke McFarland, who had respective eighth- and ninth-place times of 19:37.5 and 19:41.5.
Emma Brown, 19:54; Siena Muraszewski, 20:19.4, and Codianne Palczewski, 21:49.0, also scored for the Chieftains.
Lidia Clancy finished in 20:06 to pace Dakota. Aubrey Rizzo, 20:23.6; Julia Timpa, 20:27.9; Mylene Pham, 20:51.2, and Ryann Smitka, 21:07.6, also scored for the Cougars.
Others who finished in the top 21 were Grace Grupido, Fraser, 19:30.5; Emmerson Clor, Romeo, 19:35.9; Ella Goodsell, Romeo, 19:52.1; Reese Rosbolt, Romeo, 19:55.3; Maggie Baginski, Eisenhower, 20:41.4; Katelyn Frazier, Fraser, 20:42.1; Jacalyn Yakel, Eisenhower, 20:42.6, and Alice Foley, Fraser, 20:59.7.
Fraser moved into the Red Division this season, replacing Grosse Pointe South, which went to the White.
The Ramblers finished fourth with 92 points. Eisenhower had 136, St. Clair 154, Grosse Pointe North 191 and Anchor Bay 243 in the only division jamboree of the season. The division meet will be Sept. 19.
Dakota, led by individual winner Lucas LaMilza, won the boys jamboree.
